Module org.example.eiscuno
Package org.example.eiscuno.model.game

Class GameUno

java.lang.Object
org.example.eiscuno.model.game.GameUno
All Implemented Interfaces:
IGameUno
public class GameUno extends Object implements IGameUno
Represents a game of Uno.

This class manages the game logic, including card distribution, player actions, and interactions between players, the deck, and the table.

    • GameUno

      public GameUno(Player humanPlayer, Player machinePlayer, Deck deck, Table table)
      Constructs a new GameUno instance.
      Parameters:
      humanPlayer - the human player participating in the game
      machinePlayer - the machine player participating in the game
      deck - the deck of cards used in the game
      table - the table where cards are placed during the game

  • Method Details

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Starts the Uno game by distributing cards to players.

      Each player receives 10 cards from the deck, with the first half assigned to the human player and the remaining half to the machine player.

      Specified by:
      startGame in interface IGameUno

    • isGameOver

      public Boolean isGameOver()
      Checks if the game is over.
      Specified by:
      isGameOver in interface IGameUno
      Returns:
      true if the deck is empty, indicating the game is over; otherwise, false
